description: A simple grammar: sequences of pairs of cycles.
links: INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 775
formula: a(n) = (-1)^n*Sum_{k=0..floor(n/2)} Stirling1(n, 2*k)*(2*k)!. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 22 2003E.g.f.: 1/(1-log(1-x)^2).a(n) = D^n(1/(1-x^2)) evaluated at x = 0, where D is the operator exp(x)*d/dx. Cf. A006252. - _Peter Bala_, Nov 25 2011a(n) ~ n!/2 * exp(n)/(exp(1)-1)^(n+1). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 30 2013
author: encyclopedia(AT)pommard.inria.fr, Jan 25 2000
